algorithm_technique: Depth-First Search (DFS) with backtracking and visited set.
problem_summary_simple: Clean all accessible cells in a room using a robot with limited movement and cleaning capabilities.
problem_summary_technical: Employ DFS to explore the grid, cleaning cells and backtracking to avoid cycles and walls.
time_complexity: O(N), where N is the number of cells in the room.
space_complexity: O(N), for the visited set and recursion stack.
key_insights: The room layout is unknown, requiring exploration.
DFS is suitable for exploring connected components and finding all reachable cells.
A 'visited' set is crucial to prevent infinite loops and redundant cleaning.
Backtracking (moving back to the previous cell) is essential after exploring a path.
